headline: Easy Peanut Butter Energy Balls
description: These peanut butter and oatmeal energy balls with chocolate chips and honey are just the ticket when you need a boost of energy during the day.
name: Easy Peanut Butter Energy Balls
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup honey, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine oats, peanut butter, crushed walnuts, chocolate chips, and honey in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment; beat until well combined, adding more honey if the mixture is not holding together.
Form 24 balls with a cookie scoop and place on a cookie sheet. Refrigerate until firm, 30 to 60 minutes.

review.reviewBody: i added sunflower and pumpkin seeds. should have added more peanut butter to bind them together a bit more. tasted delicious!
I made these but added my own twist! Raisins!! You won’t be disappointed, I wasn’t!!
very easy and fast

This are excellent little energy bites! I usually add what I have and then roll in oatmeal, coconut, or left over crushed cereal. I also wrapped them individually in wax paper, place in a zip lock bag, and pop them in the freezer. A great little "go to" item when you need a quick pick up snack until you can eat a meal.
It was great, but I did have to put in extra peanut butter.
I added cacao to them but done them as the recipe reads and where great! I think you could add anything you wanted! Can’t goof this up!
These are great. You can add in what ever you have and they make great snacks. I made them as is, and I made them with craisins and pecans. Tough part is not eating too many at once!
Really good recipe! I've been looking for one that didn't need too many ingredients. Super easy to put together.
Fun family cooking activity! Perfect power snack for all ages.

I mixed 1/4 cup honey with 1/4 cup maple syrup - otherwise the batter wouldn't stick together. I used my medium size cookie scoop and only got 20 balls. If you want 24, use a small size cookie scoop (1/4 cup size.)
The family loves them
Absolutely terrific! I added 1/2 Cup Honey as well as 1/4 Cup Shredded Sweetened Coconut and 1/3 Cup Dried Cranberries. Amazing!

I did end up using. Little more honey as the recipe stated I might. I did add a little bit more of the chocolate chips. I used the mini chips. My family absolutely loved these. I passed the recipe on to several friends & their families loved them too! My family is already asking me to make more! Thank you for this great recipe!
I can not get mine to stick together. I added honey and added more honey and still will not stick together.
This recipe is so easy and tasty. Just rolled them in coconut for colour and we are 3 adults and they didn’t last 3 days. Will make them again for a healthy snack..
Wonderful recipe. I made this before my weekly gym routine for the drive home. Worked out perfectly and they store great. Will be making this again.

Super easy, as the recipe title says. The walnuts add great flavor - I was in a hurry and thought it called for 1/2 cup of walnuts - next time I'll add more. I reserve 5 stars for the absolute WOW recipes but this one is definitely worth saving and I'll probably make it again. Thank you for posting, Mama Wads!

Instead of chocolate chips I used craisins also flaxseed meal
about 1/3,cup
It is absolutely delicous. My son loves them.
I used peanuts instead of walnuts. I also added 1/4 cup chia seeds and 1/4 cup flax seeds will need to up honey and peanut butter
Quick simple and easy. A tasty little peanut butter ball to snack on when you just need a little something to hold you over until dinner time. Thank you for the recipe.
